alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Pulaski; White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 11:13AM EST until February 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio...Michigan... Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Pulaski, White and Carroll Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Marshall, Fulton IN, Starke and Kosciusko Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Three Rivers affecting Elkhart, St. Joseph MI and Branch Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. .No additional rainfall is expected over the next 48 hours, and snow melt will be gradual enough to not cause additional rises on rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River above Winamac. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Extensive residential flooding is in progress. At 10.0 feet, Some residences are affected by flood water and the Winamac town park floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Friday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 8.6 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 06/04/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
